thread.title: Joel Embiid Not Named To NBA All-Star Game
thread.title_full: Joel Embiid Not Named To NBA All-Star Game

author: CBS Philly
title: Joel Embiid Not Named To NBA All-Star Game
text:
Joel Embiid Not Named To NBA All-Star Game January 26, 2017 7:16 PM By Ray Boyd Filed Under: Joel Embiid , nba , sixers (Photo by Mitchell Leff/Getty Images) 
PHILADELPHIA (CBS) â€” The reserves for the 2017 NBA All-Star game were announced on Thursday night and Sixers rookie center Joel Embiid has been left off the roster. 
Embiid is having a stellar rookie campaign and is already putting up numbers that have some speculating that he already falls among the best centers in the NBA. His performance has earned him a spot on the World Team for this yearâ€™s Rising Stars Challenge , a team that he will play on alongside fellow rookie Dario Saric. 
Sixers Are A â€˜Thingâ€™ Again As â€˜The Processâ€™ Finally Pays Off 
On the season, Embiid is averaging 19.8 points, 7.9 rebounds, 2.5 blocks and 2.1 assists all in just 25.3 minutes per game. He is also shooting 34.8 percent from beyond the arc and an impressive 77.7 percent from the free throw line. 
Embiid responded to not making the squad with his signature humor on Twitter. Once again the popular vote didn't matterâ€¦â€¦ 
â€” Joel Embiid (@JoelEmbiid) January 27, 2017 
His proclamation that the Sixers were thinking playoffs seems to have been the catalyst for the Sixersâ€™ resurgence. The Eastern Conference Reserves are ready to perform on the big stage in NOLA! #NBAAllStar ðŸŽ¶ pic.twitter.com/zXHOyuLWAs 
â€” NBA on TNT (@NBAonTNT) January 27, 2017 
The players named to the Easter Conference bench were Kevin Love, John Wall, Paul George, Paul Millsap, Isaiah Thomas, Kyle Lowry and Kemba Walker.
